cast.overview: A young Jewish American man endeavors—with the help of eccentric, distant relatives—to find the woman who saved his grandfather during World War II—in a Ukrainian village which was ultimately razed by the Nazis.
cast.title: Everything Is Illuminated

crew.overview: A young Jewish American man endeavors—with the help of eccentric, distant relatives—to find the woman who saved his grandfather during World War II—in a Ukrainian village which was ultimately razed by the Nazis.
crew.title: Everything Is Illuminated

crew.overview: A year after his father's death, Oskar, a troubled young boy, discovers a mysterious key he believes was left for him by his father and embarks on a scavenger hunt to find the matching lock.
crew.title: Extremely Loud & Incredibly Close

details.biography:
From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia.

Jonathan Safran Foer (born February 21, 1977) is an American author best known for his novels Everything Is Illuminated (2002) and Extremely Loud and Incredibly Close (2005). In 2009, he published a work of nonfiction entitled Eating Animals.

Description above from the Wikipedia article Jonathan Safran Foer, licensed under CC-BY-SA, full list of contributors on Wikipedia.
details.name: Jonathan Safran Foer
